business.headline: What India really needs to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047IndiaToday.in reached out to leading economists to understand what needs to happen over the next two decades. What emerges is a vision that goes far beyond incremental reforms, combining growth, inclusivity, resilience, and sustainability.
HDFC Bank share crash explained: Did it actually fall over 50%?HDFC Bank's shares appeared to have tanked over 50% compared to the previous close on Dalal Street in early trade.

Switching from UPS to NPS? Here's what employees must knowCentral government employees now have a one-time chance to switch from the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) to the National Pension System (NPS). But the move comes with strict rules, deadlines, and conditions.

Simplified, new tax rules and forms: What you need to knowThe Income Tax department is working on new rules and forms under the Income-tax Act, 2025, which will be notified by December-end to ensure a smoother, simpler process for taxpayers.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Sensex crashes 600 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Sensex, Nifty tank nearly 1% as US tariff fears spook D-Street investorsThe Sensex fell over 500 points, while the Nifty slipped below the psychological 24,900 mark in early trade, mirroring global risk-off cues.

What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

entertainment.headline: BTS' V throws first pitch during baseball game, shares hug with OhtaniBTS member Kim Taehyung, aka V, made his solo debut on the MLB pitch for a baseball game with his very first ceremonial throw, and it was nothing short of adorable.

Gaurav Khanna is the only power player of Bigg Boss 19 so far'Bigg Boss 19' has just begun, but TV star Gaurav Khanna is already stealing the spotlight. From trending hashtags to his discipline, charm and fan following, here's why he is emerging as the strongest contestant on Salman Khan's reality show.

Baseer Ali on Bigg Boss 19: Game of personality, followers cannot help you winBaseer Ali, known for Roadies and Splitsvilla, entered Bigg Boss 19 recently. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he opened up about his growth in Mumbai and his ambitions in reality TV.

Armaan Malik reacts to brother Amaal joining Bigg Boss 19, calls it boarding schoolArmaan Malik admitted he wasn't in favour of his brother Amaal Malik joining 'Bigg Boss 19', joking that he should treat it like boarding school and return soon to finish pending songs.

Gurmeet Choudhary, Debina Bonnerjee bring Ganpati Bappa home with daughtersTelevision couple Gurmeet Choudhary and Debina Bonnerjee welcomed Ganpati Bappa home with their daughters Lianna and Divisha, keeping their annual tradition alive. A viral video of the family taking the idol home has won hearts.

Mika Singh mistakes Priyadarshan's retirement as death, trolled for Om shanti gaffeMika Singh confused a post about Priyadarshan's retirement with a death announcement. Fans trolled him for commenting 'Om Shanti' on the post and said that he is still alive.

Govinda-Ssunita's divorce rumours are baseless, says filmmaker Pahlaj NihalaniVeteran filmmaker Pahlaj Nihalani dismissed rumours of trouble in Govinda and Ssunita Ahuja's marriage, calling the divorce buzz baseless. He described the couple as buddies who live and work together, stressing he had never seen signs of separation between them.

Aarti shares cryptic posts after actor-husband Ravi-Keneeshaa's temple tripActor Ravi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti, shared cryptic posts on Instagram after his temple visit with his 'companion' Keneeshaa. Ravi and Aarti's divorce case is currently going on.

Tamil film 3BHK finds an admirer in Sachin Tendulkar. Director Sri Ganesh reactsCricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar named the Tamil film '3BHK', starring Siddharth and Sarathkumar, as one of his recent favourites. The film's director Sri Ganesh expressed his joy on X.

Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala's cryptic post: Family not free pass to mistreatActor Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala Dutt opened up about manipulative family dynamics by sharing a cryptic note. She urged prioritising mental health over preserving family image.

American comedian Reginald Carroll shot dead in Mississippi shootingStand-up comedian Reggie Carroll died after a shooting incident in Mississippi, United States. His death has shocked the comedy community and led to a police investigation.

Avneet Kaur reacts to Virat Kohli liking her Insta post: Let the love keep comingAvneet Kaur addressed the social media controversy involving Virat Kohli. At the trailer launch of her film 'Love in Vietnam', she reacted to the incident, saying "let the love come".

All about Armaan Malik's first stadium tour bringing global pop vision homeArmaan Malik prepares for his first-ever stadium show in Mumbai, culminating a multi-city tour that celebrates his evolution from Bollywood playback singer to global pop artist.

Kumail Nanjiani says he signed 6 MCU films, turned to therapy after Eternals failedKumail Nanjiani reveals how the poor reception of Marvel's Eternals deeply affected him. He sought therapy to cope with the unexpected career and personal challenges that followed.

Vidya Balan calls Parineeta her dream debut as it returns to cinemas after 20 yearsVidya Balan's debut film 'Parineeta' will be re-released on its 20th anniversary. Ahead of that, the actor called it her "dream debut".

BTS' Jin returns to South Korea to host manager Kim Taehyung's weddingBTS member Jin is back in South Korea to host the wedding of a close manager. Just a day earlier, he was seen in the audience at his juniors' concert, TOMORROW X TOGETHER.

Soha Ali Khan launches podcast on women's wellness and ageingSoha Ali Khan has launched a wellness podcast called 'All About Her' focusing on women's insecurities and ageing. The show aims to create a safe, unfiltered space for conversations on wellness and self-kindness.

Kartik Aaryan sets on a non-stop 48-hour shoot marathon after returning from LondonActor Kartik Aaryan returned to Mumbai after a relaxing London holiday. He updated about his intense 48-hour shoot marathon on social media.

Vishal Malhotra on Ishq Vishk mania: Fans scratched us, I still bear the markActor Vishal Malhotra fondly recalled the memorable release day of 'Ishq Vishk', highlighting both the film's success and the overwhelming fan frenzy that left him physically marked. The film hit theatres in 2003.

general news.headline: PM launches Maruti Suzuki's e Vitara in big 'Make in India, Make for World' pushIn his major Swadeshi push ahead of Donald Trump's additional tariffs taking effect, PM Modi inaugurated Suzuki Motor Plant's localised production of hybrid battery electrodes and flagged off the export of Maruti Suzuki's first global battery electric vehicle, the e Vitara, to over 100 countries, including European nations and Japan.

Trump says will allow 600,000 Chinese students into US, MAGA goes into meltdownWhile trying to keep a fragile trade truce with China, Trump risks alienating his core base with his concessions, albeit made with gritted teeth, to Beijing.

Noida dowry death: Accused husband had an affair, hit lover after wife caught themIn October last year, an FIR was filed in Noida after the woman with whom Vipin was having an affair alleged that he had beaten her when his wife caught them together. The FIR was based on her complaint, which accused Vipin of assault and exploitation.

1.5 lakh bighas and a storm: What Himanta's eviction drive has achievedAssam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's eviction campaign has not only freed over 1.5 lakh bigha of land since 2021 but has stirred a storm ahead of the 2026 Assembly election. The Opposition alleges communal bias, political polarisation and collusion with industrialists. While Sarma frames the drive as vital to protecting Assam's identity and resources, critics say it targets Bengali-speaking Muslims.

Trump vs China: Why US can't afford to mess with the DragonDonald Trump roared into office with an aggressive stance against China. The tariff battle peaked in April when the highest duty touched 145% on Chinese goods. Since then, Trump has been lenient with China. What explains the sudden change of tack by Trump?

BJP may get new national president ahead of Bihar polls announcement: SourcesThe BJP is likely to appoint a new national president before the Bihar Assembly election announcement, sources said. A panel of names has been prepared, and consultations will resume after the Vice President election on September 9.

What's wrong with Africa's map? Does it concern India too?The African Union has intensified a campaign for the use of the "right map of Africa". In the widely used Mercator map, Africa appears smaller than it is. In a bid to depict the continent's relative size accurately, African leaders are challenging the outdated colonial perspectives for fairer perceptions in education, media, and policy. Should India, which is also depicted smaller than it is, take it up?

Gandhi family is my God: DK Shivakumar 'ready to apologise' over RSS anthem rowKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said he would apologise if his RSS anthem recital hurt anyone but denied political pressure, stressing his lifelong loyalty to the Gandhi family and unwavering commitment to the Congress.

Can't sleep without your blanket? Here's what psychology saysWhen our sleep cycle is disturbed, say by a missing blanket or because we are in an unfamiliar environment, it can feel nearly impossible to drift off.

After PM's 'silent crisis' warning, India drafts first obesity guidelinesIndia is developing its first national obesity guideline to address the growing health crisis. The new plan will focus on early intervention, prevention, and use of emerging treatments.

Video: DMK Minister's son's medal snub to BJP's Annamalai at sporting eventTamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Raja's son, Suryaa Raaja Baalu, refused to let BJP leader K Annamalai garland him with a medal at the State Shooting Games, choosing instead to accept it by hand.

US tech firms not your piggy bank: Trump's fresh tariff threat over digital taxUS President Donald Trump has threatened additional tariffs on countries imposing digital taxes on American tech firms. This move escalates tensions over global digital tax policies and trade relations.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Harassment happens if you roam after 12 am: Chennai cop's remark to woman draws flakA woman in Chennai feeding stray dogs at night was told by a cop, "harassment happens if you roam around like this after 12 am." The viral remark drew criticism, but police have not taken any action yet.

Before Indians walk on the Moon, Isro plans Chandrayaan-6, 7 & 8The government has already given the green light to Chandrayaan-4 and Chandrayaan-5, both of which will play pivotal roles in advancing India's lunar science and technology.

Apple to open fourth India store in Pune on September 4Apple is set to open its fourth official store in India, this time in Pune. The company has announced that the new retail space, named Apple Koregaon Park, will welcome customers from September 4 at 1PM.

Mika Singh mistakes Priyadarshan's retirement as death, trolled for Om shanti gaffeMika Singh confused a post about Priyadarshan's retirement with a death announcement. Fans trolled him for commenting 'Om Shanti' on the post and said that he is still alive.

ED raids AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj's home in hospital construction scamThe ED searched 13 locations linked to AAP leader Saurabh Bhardwaj in a money laundering probe tied to alleged corruption in Rs 5,590 crore hospital projects sanctioned by the former Delhi government.

Meet your UPSC interview panel: People behind the final verdictUPSC interview boards consist of handpicked experts who evaluate candidates impartially. Their secretive composition ensures fairness and prevents any bias in selecting India's civil servants.

Interstellar comet invading Solar System glows in latest pictureThe comet, originating from beyond our solar system, continues to draw attention from astronomers worldwide as multiple Nasa space telescopes examine its unusual characteristics.

Lakshya Sen needs belief in process, no quick fixes on the road to revivalLakshya Sen's first-round exit at the BWF World Championships in Paris extends a challenging run, but there were glimpses of his old brilliance on Monday. Speaking to IndiaToday.in, coach Vimal Kumar says the 24-year-old must trust the process, play with conviction, and resist desperation to return to winning ways.

Sensex crashes 600 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Starved, confined at home: Telangana woman allegedly killed by husband over dowryA 33-year-old woman was found dead in Telangana after alleged prolonged starvation and abuse by her husband and in-laws. Police have registered a suspicious death case, investigations are ongoing. Family accuses husband of dowry-related cruelty.

Gujarat auto driver's conversation with passenger reveals hard truth of survival"The kind of India we ignore," read the title of the post shared on the r/India subreddit that has triggered conversations about struggles that often go unnoticed in everyday life.

Sivakarthikeyan to Shiva Rajkumar, celebs at Ravi Mohan's production house launchActor Ravi Mohan launched his maiden production house, Ravi Mohan Studios, in a grand manner in Chennai on August 26. Sivakarthikeyan, Shiva Rajkumar, Karthi and several other celebrities were present at the event to congratulate Ravi.

Mika Singh mistakes Priyadarshan's retirement as death, trolled for Om shanti gaffeMika Singh confused a post about Priyadarshan's retirement with a death announcement. Fans trolled him for commenting 'Om Shanti' on the post and said that he is still alive.

He described the couple as buddies who live and work together, stressing he had never seen signs of separation between them.

Aarti shares cryptic posts after actor-husband Ravi-Keneeshaa's temple tripActor Ravi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti, shared cryptic posts on Instagram after his temple visit with his 'companion' Keneeshaa. Ravi and Aarti's divorce case is currently going on.

sports.headline: Santner, Phillips among big names injured for New Zealand ahead of long home seasonNew Zealand players Mitchell Santner, Finn Allen, Glenn Phillips and Will O' Rourke are suffering from various injuries ahead of their long home season, where they will host Australia, England, West Indies and South Africa.

Asia Cup debutants Oman announce squad, Jatinder Singh to lead 17-member squadOman became the sixth team to announce their squad for the Asia Cup. The side announced a 17-member team, with opener Jastinder Singh leading the side.

Sachin Tendulkar breaks silence on Joe Root nearing his all-time Test runs milestoneLegendary India batter Sachin Tendulkar recently praised Joe Root's prolific run in Tests as he's approaching his record for most runs in the format.

Buzz cut Alcaraz powers himself into 2nd round with straight sets winCarlos Alcaraz debuted a fresh buzz cut and won his US Open first-round match. His strong performance overshadowed mixed fan reactions to his new look.

16-year-old Ngumoha scripts history as Liverpool down Newcastle in injury timeSixteen-year-old Rio Ngumoha scored a stunning stoppage-time winner for Liverpool against Newcastle. His historic goal secured a thrilling 3-2 victory.

Pujara is a whitewalker, his contributions are no less than Kohli and Rohit: R AshwinFormer India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has compared Cheteshwar Pujara to a 'Whitewalker', mentioning that his contributions to Indian cricket were as similar as Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

Lakshya Sen needs belief in process, no quick fixes on the road to revivalLakshya Sen's first-round exit at the BWF World Championships in Paris extends a challenging run, but there were glimpses of his old brilliance on Monday. Speaking to IndiaToday.in, coach Vimal Kumar says the 24-year-old must trust the process, play with conviction, and resist desperation to return to winning ways.

Virat Kohli felt like he was not wanted in the Test team: Former India batterFormer India batter Manoj Tiwary has made a big claim that Virat Kohli retired from Test cricket as he must've felt unwanted in the team.

Is that really Carlos Alcaraz? Star looks unrecognisable in new hairdoUS Open: Spanish star Carlos Alcaraz sported a new look in the first round of the US Open. The new haircut shocked many, including his close friend Frances Tiafoe.

Jasprit Bumrah's injuries are inevitable, irrespective of training: Farveez MaharoofFormer Sri Lanka all-rounder Farveez Maharoof explained the reasons behind Jasprit Bumrah's constant injuries. He also revealed his favourites for Asia Cup 2025 and admiration for Yashasvi Jaiswal.

45-year-old Venus Williams turns back the clock, but falls in fighting returnA 45-year-old Venus Williams made her long-awaited return to the Grand Slams on Tuesday, August 26. Playing against 11th seed Karolina Muchova, Williams lost in a 3-set battle.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
